results.title: Delayed drug-induced liver injury (DILI) and flare of chronic plaque psoriasis secondary to lisinopril use.
results.text_hl: In this case, we present a man with symptoms of @DISEASE_Jaundice_Obstructive @DISEASE_MESH:D041781 @@@cholestatic jaundice@@@, a @<m>DISEASE_Exanthema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005076 @@@blistering skin rash@@@ and flare of @DISEASE_Psoriasis @DISEASE_MESH:D011565 @@@chronic plaque psoriasis@@@, 27 months after @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ initiation for @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Jarman GL, Webb GJ. Delayed drug-induced liver injury (DILI) and flare of chronic plaque psoriasis secondary to lisinopril use. BMJ Case Rep. 2024 Jan 23;17(1):. PMID: 38262719
citations.BibTeX: @article{38262719, title={Delayed drug-induced liver injury (DILI) and flare of chronic plaque psoriasis secondary to lisinopril use.}, author={Jarman GL and Webb GJ}, journal={BMJ Case Rep}, volume={17}, number={1}}

results.title: Performance of the ChatGPT large language model for decision support in community pharmacy.
results.text_hl: The decision-support scenarios consisted of a subject with @DISEASE_Eyelid_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D005141 @@@swollen eyelids@@@ and a @<m>DISEASE_Exanthema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005076 @@@maculopapular rash@@@ in a subject on @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_ferrous_sulfate @CHEMICAL_MESH:C020748 @@@ferrous sulfate@@@.

citations.NLM: Shin E, Hartman M, Ramanathan M. Performance of the ChatGPT large language model for decision support in community pharmacy. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 2024 Aug 27;():. PMID: 39191671

results.title: Adult-Onset Immunoglobulin A Vasculitis With Renal Involvement
results.text_hl: At the one-month follow-up, his @<m>DISEASE_Exanthema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005076 @@@skin rash@@@ had completely resolved.

citations.NLM: Khor SY, Osman AF, Haddad I, AlAttal S, Khan N. Adult-Onset Immunoglobulin A Vasculitis With Renal Involvement Cureus. 2022 Mar;14(3):e23649. PMID: 35505746

results.title: Boroxazolidones: Synthesis, In Silico and In Vitro Evaluation as ACE/AChE Dual Inhibitors, and In Vivo Testing of Antihypertensive Activity.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@Hypertension@@@ can be effectively treated with inhibitors of the @GENE_ACE @GENE_1636 @@@Angiotensin Converting Enzyme@@@ (@GENE_ACE @GENE_1636 @@@ACE@@@), such as @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@, @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@. However, these drugs are associated with significant adverse reactions (e.g., persistent coughing, @<m>DISEASE_Exanthema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005076 @@@skin rashes@@@, and @DISEASE_Angioedema @DISEASE_MESH:D000799 @@@angioedema@@@).

citations.NLM: Alina BN, José G TF, Erik AJ, Jessica E RR, Itzell A GO, Rafael VM. Boroxazolidones: Synthesis, In Silico and In Vitro Evaluation as ACE/AChE Dual Inhibitors, and In Vivo Testing of Antihypertensive Activity. Curr Med Chem. 2024 Aug 30;():. PMID: 39219430
citations.BibTeX: @article{39219430, title={Boroxazolidones: Synthesis, In Silico and In Vitro Evaluation as ACE/AChE Dual Inhibitors, and In Vivo Testing of Antihypertensive Activity.}, author={Alina BN and José G TF and Erik AJ and Jessica E RR and Itzell A GO and Rafael VM}, journal={Curr Med Chem}}

results.title: Lisinopril use in a large military medical center.
results.text_hl: The most common adverse drug reactions detected were @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ (7%), @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@ (3%), and @<m>DISEASE_Exanthema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005076 @@@rash@@@ (2%). @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ were also prescribed several drugs that may interact with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Wirebaugh SR, Spencer GA, McIntyre TH. Lisinopril use in a large military medical center. Mil Med. 1997 Feb;162(2):113-7. PMID: 9038030
citations.BibTeX: @article{9038030, title={Lisinopril use in a large military medical center.}, author={Wirebaugh SR and Spencer GA and McIntyre TH}, journal={Mil Med}, volume={162}, number={2}, pages={113-7}}

results.title: Toxicodynamic analysis of inflammatory reactions by an angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor (lisinopril) in guinea-pig skin.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@Inflammatory@@@ responses were measured in two perpendicular directions serially, and the areas of @<m>DISEASE_Exanthema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005076 @@@rash@@@ were used as an index of @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory reaction@@@ induced by @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Ito K, Ito K, Sawada Y, Iga T. Toxicodynamic analysis of inflammatory reactions by an angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor (lisinopril) in guinea-pig skin. J Pharm Pharmacol. 1995 Jun;47(6):499-502. PMID: 7674133

results.title: The antihypertensive effect of lisinopril compared to atenolol in patients with mild to moderate hypertension.
results.text_hl: Five @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (1.7%) on @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and four (2.0%) on @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ developed @<m>DISEASE_Exanthema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005076 @@@skin rashes@@@ during weeks 1-12.

citations.NLM: Bolzano K, Arriaga J, Bernal R, Bernardes H, Calderon JL, Debruyn J, Dienstl F, Drayer J, Goodfriend TL, Gross W. The antihypertensive effect of lisinopril compared to atenolol in patients with mild to moderate hypertension. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1987;9 Suppl 3():S43-7. PMID: 2442551

results.title: Evaluation of antihypertensive efficacy of lisinopril compared to metoprolol in moderate to severe hypertension.
results.text_hl: These decreases in systolic blood pressures were maintained at week 8, again with statistical significance (p less than 0.01). Of the 118 @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@-treated @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, four were discontinued from @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ therapy because of @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Exanthema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005076 @@@rash@@@, @DISEASE_Flushing @DISEASE_MESH:D005483 @@@flushing@@@, or @DISEASE_Lymphatic_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D008206 @@@lymphadenopathy@@@.

citations.NLM: Zachariah PK, Bonnet G, Chrysant SG, DeBacker G, Goldstein R, Herrera J, Lindner A, Materson BJ, Maxwell MH, McMahon FG. Evaluation of antihypertensive efficacy of lisinopril compared to metoprolol in moderate to severe hypertension. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1987;9 Suppl 3():S53-8. PMID: 2442553
